summary: Michael Arata, M.D., faced reciprocal disciplinary action by the Maryland Board of Physicians due to prior discipline by the California Medical Board. Allegations included performing a risky, unproven procedure (TVAM) on an MS patient, gross negligence, excessive testing, inadequate record-keeping, and billing irregularities. The Maryland Board revoked his license, but the revocation was stayed, and he was placed on five years of probation with conditions, including compliance with the California Board's order.
